conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid from each starting point (A, B, C, D) through the baffles and into the containers (E or F).
Liquid from A will hit the green baffle, which is angled downwards to the right.
Liquid from A will follow the slope of the green baffle and move towards the right.
Liquid from A will then hit the orange baffle, which is angled downwards to the left.
Liquid from A will follow the slope of the orange baffle and move towards the left.
Liquid from A will ultimately flow into container E.
Liquid from B will hit the cyan baffle, which is angled downwards to the left.
Liquid from B will follow the slope of the cyan baffle and move towards the left.
Liquid from B will then hit the orange baffle, which is angled downwards to the left.
Liquid from B will follow the slope of the orange baffle and move towards the left.
Liquid from B will ultimately flow into container E.
Liquid from C will hit the blue baffle, which is angled downwards to the right.
Liquid from C will follow the slope of the blue baffle and move towards the right.
Liquid from C will then hit the gray baffle, which is angled downwards to the right.
Liquid from C will follow the slope of the gray baffle and move towards the right.
Liquid from C will ultimately flow into container F.
Liquid from D will hit the white baffle, which is angled downwards to the left.
Liquid from D will follow the slope of the white baffle and move towards the left.
Liquid from D will then hit the gray baffle, which is angled downwards to the right.
Liquid from D will follow the slope of the gray baffle and move towards the right.
Liquid from D will ultimately flow into container F.
Liquid from starting points A and B will flow into container E.
Liquid from starting points C and D will flow into container F.
